text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service

The Chief Counsel Quarterly(CCQ) is the Office of Chief Counsel’s time and workload compendium. The CCQ shows receipts, closures, and ending inventory by established categories of work called aliases for all organizational levels. The CCQ also provides time reporting information for executives, managers, attorneys, paralegals, and other professionals. The CCQ provides data in both numerical and graphical form and serves a variety of internal infor
mation needs of the Office including:

) Program and product costing and strategic planning (cid:
) IRS Data Book and other annual workload reports (cid:

) Ad hoc requests The CCQ is produced on a quarterly, fiscal year basis by the Planning and Management Division of the Associate Chief Counsel (Finance and Manage- ment). The CCQ is published on the Chief Counsel intranet no later than

days after the close of each quarter of the fiscal year. Archived reports for recent past fiscal years are available on the intranet; reports are available upon request from the Planning and Management Division. The Associate Chief Counsel (Finance and Management), through the Planning and Management Division, coordinates and conducts customer and employee satisfaction surveys. The Survey Program helps to determine how well the Office meets or exceeds the reasonable expectations of its internal and external customers as well as its employees. Data gathered and by the program is used for a wide range of purposes, including evaluating programs and work products, assessing the effectiveness of information systems and administrative services, and acquiring a plethora of information about the workplace and employees. Executive Order

), required agencies to “survey customers to determine the kind and quality of services they want and their level of satisfaction with existing services.” In response, the Assistance in Survey Coordination Program, now referred to as the Survey Program, was implemented that year.
